title: Apple, Robinhood, Visa, Western Digital: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Apple notched record quarterly results; Robinhood reported a bigger-than-expected loss
text:
* Robinhood Markets dropped 12% premarket after the brokerage reported a loss of $423 million for the fourth quarter.

Robinhood shares were falling premarket. PHOTO: Amir Hamja for The Wall Street Journal

* Visa gained 4.6%. The company reported higher earnings and revenue for the recent quarter as it saw growth in payments volume, cross-border volume and processed transactions.

* Western Digital shares fell 9.3% ahead of the bell. The company released second-quarter financial results and said supply chain disruptions were a headwind to near-term results.

* Tesla shares slipped 1.3% premarket, a day after closing down 12%, highlighting the pressure on technology and growth stocks as investors prepare for the Fed to tighten monetary policy.

* Mondelez slipped 3.2% off hours. The food giant said higher prices for its snacks weren't enough to make up for the rising ingredient and transportation costs it faced in the latest quarter.

* Caterpillar fell 2% premarket after it reported an earnings beat, as higher manufacturing and material costs offset price increases.

* Chevron had its most profitable year since 2014, reporting Friday that it earned $15.6 billion in net income in 2021, as commodity prices surged on the back of a global economic recovery. Investors seemed to want more; its shares shed 3.8% premarket.

* Colgate-Palmolive edged down 1.8%. The consumer-products company said it expects adjusted per-share earnings growth in the low- to mid-single digits.

Chart of the Day

* The Federal Reserve is about to end America's era of easy money. That is prompting investors to reverse course on two years of investing strategies, kicking off this month's broad market rout.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Apple, Robinhood, Visa, Western Digital: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
